Ask HN: Why am I still alive?
text:
Can one of you smarty-pants tell me why I should not kill myself?

I have schizoaffective bipolar disorder, chronic pain and fatigue, and 55 year olds at homeless, have no access to consistent healthcare, and when I do they just give me drugs that make me feel sicker.

And I know my illness makes it hard for people to be around me because of my behavior. Most of my friends have cut me off, my whole family cut me off even after my nephew killed him self. And no matter how much I show people I’m helping myself no one wants to help me. The most I get is this useless help I just prolongs this nightmare.

People assume that since I mentally ill that I’ve never had a successful career but I was like many of you, making six figures at Cisco Systems.

I just don’t see an end to it. So why, that’s just my question, why?

title: Show HN: Browse Hacker News on your Kindle via browser for free
text:
tl;dr: Go to kindlehnbeta.pythonanywhere.com on your Kindle’s browser.

I wrote a wrapper over hackernews that allows me to browse it on my Kindle. Simply visit kindlehnbeta.pythonanywhere.com on your Kindle’s browser. You’ll be able to view top stories, the comments within them and even the article content that the stories link to. The articles are parsed by a library that makes its best attempt to extract the main content.

I only own a Kindle Oasis (10th Generation) and thus have only tested this on it. I’d imagine it looks fine on other Kindles, but you’ll have to tell me.

Link to screenshots: https://imgur.com/a/8kKneH0

Really, I made this for myself as a quick solution for a personal need. But it seems like there are a few of you out there that would enjoy this as well. So I am making this public for others to try out. Let me know if this is something you actually want to use. If so, and the reception is positive, then I will continue to build it out to be better and more feature complete. In addition to this, would you enjoy a generic rss feed reader as well? — one that allows you to read any rss feed right from your Kindle’s browser? I can build this if that’s something you guys really want.
